Method Detail

prettyPrint

public static byte[] prettyPrint(byte[] inBytes,
                                 boolean omitXMLDeclaration)
                          throws IOException
Pretty-prints the given XML.

The input must be well-formed. The transformation has the following effect:

  • Leading and trailing whitespace will be removed.
  • All processing instructions and doctype declarations will be removed.
  • If Xalan is the currently active XML transformer (true by default in Java 6), it will be reformatted to have two-space indents. Otherwise, indenting behavior is undefined (it may or may not be indented).
  • Attributes will use double-quotes around values.
  • All empty elements (e.g. <element><element>) will be collapsed (e.g. <element/>

Parameters:
inBytes - the xml to be pretty-printed.
omitXMLDeclaration - whether to omit the xml declaration in the output. If false, the output will not be directly embeddable in other XML documents.
Returns:
the pretty-printed XML as a UTF-8 encoded byte array.
Throws:
IOException

canonicalize

public static byte[] canonicalize(byte[] inBytes)
                           throws IOException
Produces the canonicalized form of the input document, without comments, as defined by XML Canonicalization 1.1.

NOTE: Although this method will likely fail if the input is malformed XML, successful canonicalization does not imply that the input was well-formed!

Parameters:
inBytes - the xml to be canonicalized.
Returns:
the canonicalized XML as a UTF-8 encoded byte array.
Throws:
IOException - if the input cannot be canonicalized for any reason.

closeQuietly

public static void closeQuietly(XMLStreamWriter writer)
Closes the given writer without throwing an exception on failure. Instead, a warning will be logged.

Parameters:
writer - the writer to close.

closeQuietly

public static void closeQuietly(XMLStreamReader reader)
Closes the given reader without throwing an exception on failure. Instead, a warning will be logged.

Parameters:
reader - the writer to close.

copy

public static void copy(XMLStreamReader source,
                        OutputStream sink)
                 throws XMLStreamException
Copies the subtree that the reader is currently position at to the given stream. The reader must be positioned at a START_ELEMENT event, and when finished, will be positioned on the corresponding END_ELEMENT event.

NOTE: Even if successful, this does not currently ensure that the output has all used namespaces declared. In particular, if a namespace was previously declared in the XML that the reader saw, then used within the scope of the elements being copied but no re-declared within them, the output will not be self-contained.

Parameters:
source - the reader whose subtree should be copied.
sink - the stream to write to (UTF-8 encoding will be used). It will be left open when finished.
Throws:
XMLStreamException - if anything goes wrong during the copy.

copy

public static void copy(XMLStreamReader source,
                        XMLStreamWriter sink)
                 throws XMLStreamException
Copies the subtree that the reader is currently position at to the given writer. The reader must be positioned at a START_ELEMENT event, and when finished, will be positioned on the corresponding END_ELEMENT event.

NOTE: Even if successful, this does not currently ensure that the output has all used namespaces declared. In particular, if a namespace was previously declared in the XML that the reader saw, then used within the scope of the elements being copied but no re-declared within them, the output will not be self-contained.

Parameters:
source - the reader whose subtree should be copied.
sink - the writer to copy to. It will be left open when finished.
Throws:
XMLStreamException - if anything goes wrong during the copy.
